intro: Phacelia crenulata, commonly known as the Sierra phacelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, branched stems and clusters of small, blue to purple flowers. The leaves are typically lobed and have a serrated edge, contributing to its distinctive appearance. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and open woodlands. This plant is valued for its ornamental beauty and its role in supporting pollinators.
